sources.data_found: Afton GPU node counts: A100 40GB (2 nodes, 8 GPU/node), A100 80GB (18 nodes, 8 GPU/node), H200 (1 node, 8 GPU/node), A40 (12 nodes, 8 GPU/node), A6000 (14 nodes, 8 GPU/node), V100 (2 nodes, 4 GPU/node).
DGX BasePOD: 18 DGX A100 nodes; 80GB GPU memory per GPU device; (POD docs indicate requesting up to 8 GPUs/node). Also states H200: currently one server available with 8x H200.
Rio GPU node counts: H200 (1 node, 8 GPU/node) and L40s (4 nodes, 8 GPU/node).
NIH grant-funded purchase: 36 NVIDIA Grace Hopper computing nodes (treated as 36 GH200-class nodes; 1 GPU per node assumed since only 'nodes' count is specified).

student_data.notes: Found explicit Fall 2024 enrollment counts on UVA School of Engineering and Applied Science page under the section 'Computer Science (BS)'. It lists: 'Undergraduate Enrollment (Fall 2024) – 809' and 'Graduate Enrollment (Fall 2024) - 248'. The page also states: 'Fall 2024 enrollment data was captured based on census count on January 25, 2025.' This source does NOT break the 248 graduate students into master's vs Ph.D., so grad_cs_count (masters-only) and phd_cs_count are set to 0 to avoid misclassification. (Source: ([engineering.virginia.edu](https://www.engineering.virginia.edu/undergraduate-study/current-undergrads/degree-information/undergraduate-enrollment-and-graduates)))

gpu_resources.notes: Afton/Rivanna HPC GPUs (from UVA RC 'Using UVA’s High-Performance Computing Systems'): (1) A100 80GB: 18 nodes × 8 = 144 (these correspond to the DGX BasePOD nodes; BasePOD page also says 18 DGX A100 nodes). (2) A100 40GB: 2 nodes × 8 = 16. (3) H200: 1 node × 8 = 8. (4) A6000: 14 nodes × 8 = 112. (5) V100: 2 nodes × 4 = 8. (6) A40: 12 nodes × 8 = 96. Rio secure HPC GPUs (from Ivy/Rio page): (7) H200: 1 node × 8 = 8. (8) L40s: 4 nodes × 8 = 32. Totals: H200=8+8=16; A100_80=144; A100_40=16; A6000=112; V100=8; L40s=32; A40=96. No H100/H100 SXM/PCIe or P100 counts were explicitly listed in the current UVA RC hardware tables. GH200 assumption: 36 Grace Hopper 'nodes' counted as 36 GH200-class GPUs (1 per node) because the announcement does not specify GPUs-per-node.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
